name: Hilton Amsterdam Airport Schiphol

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a Saturday and Sunday evening 22 & 23 October. To access the hotel you can use their shuttle which leaves from infront of Schiphol Plaza OR you can walk. Its well sign -posted and there are moving travel walks to aid those with trolleys or baggage. The last part of of the walk is either stairs or lift and is in the open air - but its a very short walk across the front parking area of the hotel.
reviews.title: Fine for 2 nights - close to airport, clean and very welcoming staff

reviews.text: As others have pointed out, the hotel is a 70s design and does look dated compared to newer hotels but the public areas including the foyer and bar/restaurant area are up to date and welcoming.
reviews.title: Great location - small room - and highway robbery for Wi-Fi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was fast and pleasant. Being a Gold HHonors member, my partner was given free internet access which obviously saves money. We had also booked an exec level room as we wanted to relax in the lounge at the end of the day. The lounge, on the top floor, was small but served a nice breakfast including eggs, bacon and a big selection of continental food - cereals, cheese, ham, danish, muffins, toast - lots of choice and perfectly adequate to start the day. In the evening, the snacks on offer were hot (mini pastries), cheese, fruit, hams, vegetables etc. Again a great snack to relax with over the complimentary wine (the red was particularly good) The young lady in charge of the lounge was excellent - professional, courteous and utterly committed to customer service - we both thought she was a credit to the hotel. It was very relaxing to spend an hour with some wine and snacks watching all the differnt aircraft landing and taking off at the airport. I found it fascinating!
reviews.title: Expected a little more

reviews.text: The room was an upgraded exec room. It *is* somewhat dated - especially the bathroom - BUT it was very clean and completely soundproofed - didn't hear anyone else and certainly didn't hear any airplane noise. Crabtree and |Evelyn toiletries were provided and replenished (housekeeping was excellent) The bed was king sized and had lovely crisp white sheets that were a pleasure to get into. Tea and coffee making facilities were in room, together with a mini bar, hairdryer and iron/board etc. Everything you need for either business or pleasure.
reviews.title: dated rooms, but clean and great service

reviews.text: I honestly didn't have any great expectations about staying at this hotel as we had stayed in the Radisson previously and really enjoyed it. However the Hilton was at least 120 euros a night cheaper and I would both recommend it and use it again myself.
reviews.title: It's great to be able to get off the plane and walk to your Hilton!

reviews.text: Stayed in Hilton for a day after flying in from South Africa. First of all be prepared for a walk to get there.. It took me some good 10 minutes of a brisk walk to rach the hotel. Mind you,the hotel is not in the terminal - once you reach the end of the terminal there is a short walk outside (not long, may be 50 meters) that can be not the most comfortable experience if it rains.. Check in - very quick and the staff was really friendly! The hotel itself is in need of renovation.. In some ways you feel like going back in time for 20 years.. The only thing telling you that this is 21 st century is a big flat screen TV: The furniture is old, not up to Hilton standards. Room is very small, the ventilation in my room did not work properly. Obviously as with every airport hotel the windows do not open. Internet is VERY expensive. 10 euros per hour, however they also have a 24h hour plan and internet is also included in some room packages. Room service - again expensive!! On the positive side, Schiphol Plaza is 10 minutes away with plenty of shopping/dining options available. The price of the room was not too bad but I am sure there are better alternatives available.
reviews.title: Only for a sleepover..

reviews.text: This is the perfect place if you need to sleep over one night at the Schiphol Airport in Amsterdam. All the confort and quality of a main stream Hilton just 3 minutes away from the terminal. Very corteous and helpful staff. With excelent wireless internet access and a very good breakfast buffet, this is the right place to overnight if you need to take a very early flight in Schiphol. And if you are more adventorous, it is very easy from Schiphol to catch the train to downtown Amsterdam and enjoy the wondeful night life in the city and be back to have some sleep before your departure.
reviews.title: The right place to sleep over

reviews.text: Stayed on business, the room was small and uninviting. The provisions in the room lacking and the cost of the Wifi was extortionate. I thought I was funding a new line for the hotel, not just trying to access my e-mails.
reviews.title: Poor quality - rip off wifi

reviews.text: One to avoid
reviews.title: Nice Staff, Older Hotel

reviews.text: I have been using this Hotel as a hub for business for almost 8 years and I can say that the staffs here are always superb. Well accommodating, helpful, gracious, and knowledgeable. The hotel is beginning to show its age in the rooms, the gym, the elevators, the lobby, etc. Nevertheless well situated for the necessary stop over through Amsterdam and always a staple for the quick meeting on the go.
reviews.title: Not as good as i was expecting

reviews.text: Room was small, in desperate need of a revamp and noisy because of the fridge whirring away only 1ft from the bed. Dined in the restaurant in the evening. Food and service was unremarkable. The venison was served with a cranberry sauce whose main ingredient appeared to be tomato ketchup! ( admitted by the waiter as being so).
reviews.title: Old tired rooms, terrible food, overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dessert was advertised as panna cotta, but turned out to be nothing more than whipped cream with orange zest in a glass. I asked the waiter what he thought a panna cotta was? "Cream and cheese I think Sir" !!!!!!!
reviews.title: Great if you need a room near the hotel

reviews.text: At the price we paid for the room and meal this level of laziness by the kitchen and lack of training for the staff really shouldn't happen.
reviews.title: Good location at the airport-nice lounge-rooms are average to better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We won't be staying here again, despite being Hhonor members.
reviews.title: Good option for Schiphol airport hotel

reviews.text: Booked a day room as had an 8 hour gap between flights. Sent most of my time in the hotel asleep so can't say much about the facilities but the room was clean and well presented if a little eighties in style. Very hand for the airport though - a few hundred yards down a covered walkway. Would definitely use again if I need an airport hotel.
reviews.title: Convenient but run down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stopped over at the hotel for a weekend (23-25 September). This was our first visit to Amsterdam to stay.
reviews.title: Convenience, comfort and care

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Executive room was spotless and well fitted. The quality of care and attention from all staff was first class.
reviews.title: Terrible Hotel

reviews.text: Food served for breakfast and dinner was of an excellent standard and the service was attentive but not intrusive.
reviews.title: Shabby & tired, small rooms...not the Hilton you might expect.

reviews.text: The addition of access to the Executive Lounge, together with its facilities only added to the stay.
reviews.title: Very convenient for international travelers.

reviews.text: The short walk to the Airport/Station made access to Amsterdam so convenient.
reviews.title: Tired Hilton property

description: Conveniently located next to the World Trade Centre at theinternational airport, Hilton Amsterdam Airport Schipholis close to a number of the city’s attractions. Whetherstaying for work or pleasure, enjoy friendly service, a choiceof excellent dining options and state-of-the-art facilities.AT A GLANCE• Located directly at the airport via a covered walkway• Executive Floor and Lounge• International cuisine at Greenhouse Restaurant• Fitness Room and Sauna• High speed wireless internet• 20mins from Amsterdam Central Station• Business Centre
